productName: Spring Valley Melatonin Tablets Dietary Supplement, 5 mg, 120 Count
text: I didn't believe melatonin would have worked for me since I have taken prescription medications that have caused too many side effects to continue. I was wrong! Melatonin has been a life-saving workout all the side effects I experienced on other medications. I still take a sleep medication that works okay, but combined with melatonin, it works wonders. I highly recommend this medication to anyone who has a sleep disorder as I do. I was a little apprehensive to share such details about my struggles, but after consulting with my doctor, I was given the go-ahead. I highly recommend consulting with your primary and just ask. It revolutionized my life, and my daytime sleeplessness went away.
title: Excellent choice!

productName: Spring Valley Melatonin Tablets Dietary Supplement, 5 mg, 120 Count
text: I used to have trouble staying asleep once I fell asleep, so I started taking melatonin. I was taking two three milligram tablets but that wasn't doing it. I decided to try the five milligram tablets, and that did the trick. An hour before bedtime, I take two tablets with water, and once I fall asleep, I stay asleep for eight hours straight. I don't wake up until it is time to wake up, and that has been a delight for me. It is wonderful to wake up feeling refreshed and wide awake. Melatonin has a reputation for causing odd dreams, and I have experienced that with other brands, but this brand makes me sleep so well that I don't generally recall my dreams, let alone if they were odd. The only thing that would make these better, would be if I slept for nine or ten hours! That is only because I spent years and years with insomnia to varying degrees. Eight hours does it for me, and I don't really need more than that. I wish I could sleep well, but without this I can't. I will buy this for the rest of my life. It really does help me sleep, and I stay sleeping. My daughter was in the military and frequently deployed overseas. She told me that the military told them to take ten milligrams of melatonin if they had trouble sleeping until they acclimated to the time changes. It worked well for her on the occasions she needed it, and it works for me all the time.
title: Good Night's Sleep

productName: Spring Valley Melatonin Tablets Dietary Supplement, 1 mg, 120 Count
text:
This was $5.31 total for 240 tablets, delivered as a "2 pack," two bottles , 120 count, each.

Despite some folk thinking more mg =greater effectiveness... naw.  That's not how this naturally-occurring hormone works in a human body.  Manufacturers are happy to capitalise on consumers' erroneous beliefs, so that's why you see 3mg tablets, 5mg, 10mg... there are probably even higher dosages available in a single tablet form, for higher prices.

Research the *pharmacokinetics* of melatonin if you need to understand more about how much melatonin your body uses and what happens with any excess.  Wikipedia is often reliable enough in this instance, and websites of universities and other learning institutions that end in .edu, not .com

I'm not interested in taking anything more than 1mg, because I know, for an actual fact, that my body will only use as much as it does, naturally,  and all the excess will be excreted as waste.  

It is a happy thing for me that 1mg  tablets cost less than higher doses.  I'd purchase the 300mcg tablets (that's 0.3mg, if you are unfamiliar with the conversion), as that's all a body needs, regardless who you are or how big or small you are,  but manufacturers likewise pick up on folk who know, and assume they are willing and able to pay $0.13/tablet for an accurate dosage.  No thanks.  I'll spend $0.022/tablet, and split those tablets in half..  
0.3mg tablets of melatonin always cost 5-10x more than 1mg tablets.  I'll buy the 1mg tablets and split them in two, which means I am easily paying less than 10% what I'd be charged if I purchased the .3mg tablets.

All that typed, it would be nice if 300mcg tablets of melatonin were priced ethically, but since that day shall never come, 1mg is the best deal.

If you live in the US, understand that the UK requires a doctor's prescription to get melatonin, so take your own with you  if you go!
title: Best price this naturally-occuring hormone

text:
In the past I thought Melatonin would leave me with a hangover effect. But that was decades ago. I went thru a bottle of 1mg and felt like I might could use something stronger. But I am cognizant that more is not always better.

I found a deal at a different store with a promo that brought my cost down to about 2 cents per pill. Even store brand costs more like 5 cents.

Anyway, my only beef with these is they do NOT easily break in half.  I can bite into them but even then I don't get anywhere near a clean break. I can't seem to find my pill splitter but I will try that if I do find it.

I have also found that 90-120 minutes in advance works best for me.

Probably would have given it 4 stars if not for all the "free" reviewers.

text: melatonin is a highly effective natural sleep aid. I've struggled with falling asleep and staying asleep for years, and since I started taking melatonin, I've noticed a significant improvement in the quality of my sleep. It helps me fall asleep faster, stay asleep longer, and wake up feeling refreshed and ready to take on the day. Unlike some over-the-counter sleep aids, melatonin doesn't leave me feeling groggy or sluggish in the morning, which is a huge plus.
title: Good sleep

productName: 21st Century Melatonin, 3 mg, 200 Tablets
text:
I rarely go to bed between 10 and 11 pm (22.00-23.00), which is when our body produces melatonin, so I figured out that I am probably melatonin - deficient. I also have insomnia all my life, and after my relative mentioned that melatonin helps with their insomnia, I decided to give it a try. 

The best thing about this melatonin is that it comes in the form of small pills, not capsules.
I hate taking capsules, they are often too large for me, so it's nice when it's possible to find something in a smaller size. The dosage is nice, too, just one pill. 

Effectiveness 

The first few days I took it, it almost instantly knocked me off. I always take a long time to fall asleep, and this was probably one of the first times in my life I fell asleep so fast. I would say, it takes anywhere from 15-30 minutes for the pill to start working. 

The only downside was that I sleep too long, if I take melatonin, so I cannot take it if I have to wake up early. I also gave it
to my parents, and they said the same thing. Not only they sleep, but they sleep too long. maybe the dose 3 mg is too high for me and my parents. 

My advice for those who didn't take melatonin before: do not go immediately for the highest dose - it might be too much for you. 

after a few days, my body adjusted and I would no longer fall asleep. I don't think it's the issue with the product. I think I just have other reasons for insomnia, so melatonin alone is not enough to fix the issue. When my head is clear and I am
not stressed or anxious, it works. But I always end up sleeping for more than 8 hours, which is inconvenient bc I cannot take it daily. I think my body needs melatonin daily, so if I go to bed late, I want to be able to take it and sleep 8 hours, not more. So maybe the next time I will look for lower dosage, if it exists.
title: Small tablets, easy to take

text:
Picked up this melatonin supplement to help with sleep issues. Always had trouble falling asleep and staying asleep. Been taking it for about two weeks now, and there's a noticeable difference. Used to lie awake for hours, but now I'm out within 20-30 minutes of taking it. Staying asleep longer too, without waking up in the middle of the night.

Like that it's just melatonin, nothing else. Great size and dosage. Don't have to worry about side effects or getting hooked on it. It's not a sedative either, so no groggy feeling in the morning. You can adjust the dose too. Started at 1mg, now I'm at 3mg, which works for me.

Sleep quality's better overall. Feel more rested in the morning. Just remember to check with your doctor before starting any new supplement, especially if you've got health issues or take other meds.
title: yes!

productName: Force Factor Melatonin , 3 mg, 60 Vegetable Capsules
text: I recently started taking a melatonin supplement to help with my sleep. I have always struggled with falling asleep and staying asleep. I have been taking the supplement for about two weeks now and I have noticed a significant improvement in my sleep. I used to lie awake for hours before finally falling asleep, but now I am able to fall asleep within 20-30 minutes of taking the melatonin. I also find that I am able to stay asleep for longer periods of time without waking up in the middle of the night. One of the things I love about this supplement is that it is natural and only has melatonin as its ingredient. I don't have to worry about any negative side effects or becoming dependent on it for sleep. I also appreciate that it is not a sedative, so I don't wake up feeling groggy or drowsy. I also like that the dosage can be adjusted to fit my needs. I started with a low dose of 1mg and have gradually increased it to 3mg, which seems to be the perfect amount for me.  It has made a noticeable difference in the quality of my sleep and I feel more rested and refreshed in the morning. Just remember to consult with your doctor before starting any new supplement, especially if you have any underlying health conditions or are taking other medications.
title: One of the best!

productName: Force Factor Somnapure Natural Sleep Aid with Melatonin 3mg, Sleep Supplement, 30 Tablets
text: I've had trouble sleeping for the last decade. I have trouble falling asleep and I end up watching TV late into the night. I also have a lot of trouble staying asleep, and tend to wake up 3 or 4 hours later, unable to go back to sleep. I've tried melatonin, ZzzQuil, and several other sleep aids with no luck. I've tried several types of pillows, sound machines, and diets to help. Nothing worked. So, I didn't have very high expectations with Somnapure. I was pleasantly surprised the first night when I fell asleep a bit faster than normal and I slept through the night! I can't wait to try it when I'm traveling, as that's where I tend to have the most trouble. I would recommend this product to my family and friends as a natural, non-habit forming alternative to prescription pills.
title: Helps me not only fall asleep but stay asleep.

productName: Force Factor Somnapure Natural Sleep Aid with Melatonin 3mg, Sleep Supplement, 30 Tablets
text: I have difficulty going to sleep and sometimes sleeping through the night. My doctor recommended melatonin at a dose of 3-10 mg per night. This has 4mg plus some other helpful ingredients for sleep/relaxation and works quite well most of the time. However, I still wake up during the night a few nights,2-4, a week. But it is still much better than anything else I have tried. Melatonin alone does not work for me.

text: I am not one that enjoys taking pills, but I haven't had a full night sleep since my daughter was born January 2012! When I woke during the night to use the bathroom, there was no side affects at all! (Other products would give me very negative side affects in the past). I was able to go back to sleep immediately and woke rested and no groggy feeling whatsoever! I love Force Factor Somnapure 2 because it is gradual and not all of a sudden, it's more natural feeling and I really felt great the next morning!

text:
'Mommy's Bliss' kids sleep chewable melatonin plus magnesium 
with calming herbs that support natural sleep. 

My kids enjoy these, and they are grape flavored. I make sure we have these when we travel, because sometimes it's hard for the kids to sleep, and sleep well, when they're not in their own beds. This definitely is a lifesaver when traveling. 

At home when they need it, I use separate supplements, but the chewables are perfect for travel, sleepovers with Grandma, basically any time that they are not going to be home. 

Depending on the age of the kid it's either one, two, or three chewables. It also recommends you give it to the child 30 to 60 minutes before bedtime. But I usually don't allow more than 30 minutes because we lay down and read books before sleep to help with calming down. 

This is not habit forming, I would not use this on a daily basis, just whenever we need it. There is no added sugars. Made in the USA. I highly recommend this product, I feel that it works for what we need it to do, and it's a great value.

3 mg. tablets daily. Dreams can be vivid, but they are only dreams,
and not nearly as bad as my occasional childhood nightmares.

However, I can provide a general review of melatonin tablets in that dosage range:

Melatonin is a hormone that helps regulate the sleep-wake cycle, and it is commonly used as a supplement to promote better sleep. A 5mg melatonin tablet is considered a moderate to high dosage, as melatonin supplements typically range from 0.5mg to 10mg. Great quality overall

productName: 21st Century Melatonin, 3 mg, 200 Tablets
text:
Melatonin supplements have become a staple in my nightly routine, offering a natural way to regulate my sleep patterns. As someone who occasionally struggles with falling asleep and staying asleep, melatonin has been a game-changer.

What I appreciate most about melatonin is its ability to gently signal to my body that it's time to wind down. Unlike prescription sleep aids, melatonin doesn't leave me feeling groggy or foggy in the morning. Instead, I wake up feeling refreshed and ready to tackle the day ahead.

I find that taking a melatonin supplement about 30 minutes before bedtime helps me relax and drift off more easily. It's especially useful during periods of stress or when my sleep schedule needs adjusting due to travel or changes in routine.

While it's important to start with a low dose and adjust as needed, I've found a small amount—typically around 1 to 3 milligrams—suits me perfectly. It's reassuring to know that melatonin is a hormone naturally produced by the body, making it a safe and effective choice for improving sleep quality.

Overall, melatonin supplements have earned a permanent place on my nightstand. They've helped me establish a more consistent sleep pattern and manage occasional sleep disturbances with ease. If you're looking for a non-habit forming sleep aid that supports natural sleep cycles, I highly recommend giving melatonin a try.
title: Effective Melatonin

productName: 21st Century Melatonin, 3 mg, 200 Tablets
text: I'm a long time user of 21st Century Melatonin tablets. Use for anti aging / longevity reasons as well as circadian cycles and sleep. Melatonin is all about getting the right dose for each person. Take too much and you can feel groggy the next day, take too little and not enough effect - so experiment with the dose to get it right.  21st Century is easily the best quality vs cost melatonin on iherb currently.

text: I purchased these in late July to give to my toddler. We've tried other brands before, but since converting to all natural everything, I strayed away.. within two weeks, I began to notice these blister like rashes appearing all over her upper body, but I assumed she got into something. Then her hair came out in a bald patch and was spreading. I took everything from her diet and started back adding things slowly and noticed no more issues. When I added these back, the blisters reappeared. It still wasn't until I allowed my son and myself to consume this and we both experienced the rashes that I realized this was the culprit. productName: Spring Valley Zero Sugar Kids Melatonin Sleep Support Dietary Supplement Gummies, Blackberry and Raspberry, 1 mg, 60 Count
text: My two sons have had great results with Spring Valley's Zero Sugar Kids Melatonin. These are 1mg gummies and my boys only take one about 30 minutes before bedtime and so far they have had great results. Sometimes my oldest son struggles to settle down for bed and these have really helped him to go to sleep and stay asleep. Other gummies have helped them to fall asleep, only for them to wake up and struggle to go back to sleep after only a couple hours. These gummies are sugar free and I'm pretty confident that's what the difference is. My boys like these melatonin gummies the most since they like the flavor and since they really work. Other melatonin chewables we have used tasted horrible, so they definitely like gummies better. I like these gummies better since the texture is a bit different and they don't get stuck to their teeth like other gummy vitamins. These are a great value at 60 in a bottle and only having to take one at a time. Adults could take these too, you could just take more than one if 1mg isn't enough for you.
title: Easy to take and quick to put you to sleep.

productName: Spring Valley Zero Sugar Kids Melatonin Sleep Support Dietary Supplement Gummies, Blackberry and Raspberry, 1 mg, 60 Count

I don't give them to my twins every night, but every now and then I need rescued or to put them back on a sleep schedule if we've ventured off. They work fast and my boys get a full nights sleep. I'd give them more stars if I could!

text:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] With back to school comes getting my kids back on a proper sleep schedule, as they didn't have one during the summer months.  My wife and I find that if we use kids melatonin for a few days it helps get the kids back on a sleep schedule, without dealing with them fussy in AMs or crashing mid day.  Our go to brand for kids natural products including melatonin is Mommy's Bliss. We used this brand for tummy trouble gripe water when the kids were babies, and as they got older and experienced more kid ailments and troubles, we would seek out this brand for natural non-habit forming chewables and products.  

So, when it was time to buy a bottle of melatonin chewables for back to school prep, we went with Mommy's Bliss.  This time around, we found that they had a new melatonin product available that now comes with added magnesium and calming herbs to support your child's natural sleep process. Before we would get a bottle of Mommy Bliss Melatonin that only had melatonin.  

This sugar-free chewable in grape flavor is easy for the kids to take, and works fast.  The kids start to feel tired shortly after taking, and are asleep an hour later, and stay asleep the whole night, waking restful and ready to start their days.

It only took a week to get the kids back on a proper sleep schedule, and we couldn't have done it without the help of Mommy's Bliss chewables.  If your kids are struggling to fall asleep or need to get back on a sleep schedule for school, I highly recommend you check out Mommy's Bliss chewables melatonin + magnesium.  It works great and is safe for kids and non-habit forming. Highly recommend.
title: Safe for kids and non-habit forming
